snippet: The European Central Bank, facing a sluggish eurozone economy, said it would extend the length of its asset purchases and push banks to lend by charging them more to park money.
abstract: Stocks fall in Europe after European Central Bank announces further stimulus measures; central bank's president Mario Draghi says steps 'need time to be fully appreciated.'
lead_paragraph: The European Central Bank, facing a sluggish eurozone economy, said it would extend the length of its asset purchases and push banks to lend by charging them more to park money.

headline.main: E.C.B. Announces Further Stimulus Measures, but Investors Are Unimpressed
headline.print_headline: Investors Are Unimpressed With Further Stimulus Measures in Europe
